mvc.models

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • mvc.models.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.util.Observable
    This class is the link between the program visible to the user (MainWindow / Controller) and UmlParser (which should be viewed as a library). In the MVC design pattern, it is the model which is responsible to get and manipulate data and send the to the view. The model communicates with the view by using the observer design pattern. So there could be more than one view at the time and each could react differently to messages sent. The view sends events to the controller which decides what to do (update the view or ask a bunch of stuff to the model).
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

      • analyseFile

        public void analyseFile(java.lang.String filename)
                 throws ModelException
        Analyses the specified file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the model's definition file.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown when a specific error occurs.

      • setMultipleInheritance

        public void setMultipleInheritance(java.lang.Boolean val)
        Sets whether or not multiple inheritance is allowed.
        Parameters:
        val - true if multiple inheritance is enabled, false if not.

      • sendClassInfo

        public void sendClassInfo(java.lang.String className)
        Sends the main details of a class to observers (in this project, the view). Details include attributes, methods (operations), subclasses, superclasses, associations and aggregations.
        Parameters:
        className - The class name for which details must be sent.

      • sendAggregationDetails

        public void sendAggregationDetails(java.lang.String className,
                                   int index)
        Sends details of an aggregation, contained in a class, to observers (here, the view). The index in the view is the same as the index in the ClassContainer since the Model sends the list in the order it is defined and the view does not change it.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class containing the aggregation.
        index - The index of the aggregation in the class.

      • sendAssociationDetails

        public void sendAssociationDetails(java.lang.String className,
                                   int index)
        Sends details of an association, contained in a class, to observers (here, the view). The index in the view is the same as the index in the ClassContainer since the Model sends the list in the order it is defined and the view does not change it.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class containing the aggregation.
        index - The index of the association in the class.

      • getMetrics

        public java.lang.String[][] getMetrics()
        Returns all the metrics of the classes contained in the currently parsed file.
        Returns:
        An array of array of strings. Each outer array element (a "line") is for a class and an inner array is for the name of the class followed by the values of the metrics.

      • getClass

        protected ClassContainer getClass(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the ClassContainer corresponding to name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the class.
        Returns:
        The ClassContainer if it exists, null otherwise.

      • analyseModel

        protected void analyseModel()
                     throws ModelException
        Transform a UML definition file into a collection of objects.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown when an error occurs.

      • createAndCheckClasses

        protected void createAndCheckClasses()
                              throws ModelException
        Create and checks classes from the model. Classes are added to a map, classes, and no duplicate class name can occur. Also, for every class, no duplicate attribute name or operation name/signature can occur.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown if a duplicate class name is found or if, for one class, a duplicate attribute name or operation name/signature is found.

      • createAndCheckGeneralizations

        protected void createAndCheckGeneralizations()
                                      throws ModelException
        Links superclasses with their subclasses and vice-versa.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown whenever a superclass or a subclass does not exist.

      • classContainsInheritanceCycle

        protected boolean classContainsInheritanceCycle(ClassContainer startingClass)
        Checks whether or not a cycle exists in a class inheritance.
        Parameters:
        startingClass - The class to start from.
        Returns:
        True if there is a cycle, false otherwise.

      • inheritancePathContainsCycle

        protected boolean inheritancePathContainsCycle(ClassContainer startingClass,
                                               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> visitedClasses)
        Checks, for every supeclass of a class, if going on that inheritance path a cycle exists. For every superclass, it calls this method again by adding the currentc class to a list of visited classes. If a superclass is already marked as visited or visiting that class's inheritance path returns true, then a cycle exists.
        Parameters:
        startingClass - The class to start from.
        visitedClasses - A HashMap of classes already visited (keys are the names of classes).
        Returns:
        True if a cycle exists, false otherwise.

      • createAndCheckAssociations

        void createAndCheckAssociations()
                         throws ModelException
        Links two classes that are "associated" together.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown if one of the classes in the association does not exist or if an association between the two classes already exists.

      • createAndCheckAggregations

        void createAndCheckAggregations()
                         throws ModelException
        Links classed that are linked together via aggregations. An aggregation has a "container" class and one or more "part" classes.
        Throws:
        ModelException - Thrown whenever an error occurs.

        java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,ClassContainer>> getClassIterator()
        Returns an Iterable that iterates over the entry set of classes.
        Returns:
        The iterator.

        Directly return the instance of ClassContainer from the class iterator.
        Parameters:
        iterator - The iterator.
        Returns:

        protected ModelException resetAndReturnException(ModelException.ERRORS error)
        Resets the model (to try to reduce memory) and returns a new exception.
        Parameters:
        error - The type of the error.
        Returns:
        A new instance of ModelException.

      • resetModel

        protected void resetModel()
        Resets the model by setting some properties to null so the garbage collector might be able to free some memory.
